Yes. The person who organized this|Batolympics. Mr. Brandon, the Deputy Director|who is in charge of Coliseum's Secret Menu.|

I believe that you have plotted the|Batolympics to assassinate Mr. Gorek for his|position as owner by making it look like an|
|accident!

48.「逃がしはせんっ！: I won't let you get away!

53.<center>騒然とした雰囲気の中 |表彰式が 再開されることもなく|バトリン: The Batolympics came to a close without a|resumption of the awards ceremony amidst a|tumultuous atmosphere.

54.「いやはや 大変なことになりましたなぁ。| まさか バトリンピックが ブランドン: What a mess we've gotten ourselves into! I had|no idea that the Batolympics were the result|of a conspiracy by Mr. Brandon.

56.「表彰式で 渡しそびれていた優勝賞品は| 今 ここで お渡ししましょう。: The prizes that were not handed out at the|awards ceremony will be handed out now.

58.「……と思いましたが どうやら 持ち物が| いっぱいの ご様子。あずかっておきま: I thought so, but it seems that he has a lot|of things to take with him. Please come back|later to pick up your prizes.

59.「セインズ選手や ブランドン氏の手下たちは| 陰謀に加担していたとして| あらか: It seems that Sainz and Brandon's crew have|been rounded up for their complicity in the|conspiracy.

60.「よお <pc>。| バトリンピック優勝 ご苦労だったな。| おかげで いろいろ: Hey <pc>. Thanks for winning the|Batolympics. Thanks for all the help.

61.「まあ 聞きたいこともあるだろうが| とりあえず 今回の修行も 達成したんだ。|: Well, I'm sure you have questions, but for|now, I've accomplished this training. I should|give you a reward.

62.「……よし！ | 今のオメーなら 使いこなせるだろう。| バトマスの奥義を 仕込: Okay! You're good now, you'll be able to use|it. I'm going to teach you the secrets of|battle master!

66.「ゴーレックとは 昔なじみの くされ縁でな。| 昔っから 護衛とか 頼まれること: Golek and I go way back. He's always asked me|to be his bodyguard, and this time I was|working at his request.

67.「コロシアム副理事の ブランドンに| 怪しい動きがあるから 調べてくれってさ。|:
Brandon, the assistant director of the|Coliseum, has been acting suspiciously, and he|wants me to look into it. That old man is a|
|good judge of persons.

68.「……で コロシアムに入りびたって| 例のモンスター勝ち抜き戦に 出たり| 借金: So I hung around the Coliseum, participated in|the Monster Contest, took out debts, and poked|around in various ways.

69.「けど なかなか シッポがつかめなくてな。| ようやく 何か大イベントを開いて: But I couldn't seem to get a tail on it. I|finally figured out that they were going to|have some big event and make it happen there.

70.「だが 無気力で なまけ者のオレが| いきなり そんな大会に 出場したりしたら|: But if I, a lethargic, lazy monk, were to|suddenly enter such a tournament, it would be|extremely suspicious, wouldn't it?

71.「それで 困ってたところに 現れたのが| オメーだったわけさ。あんまり 都合よく: I was in trouble, and you showed up. It was so|convenient that at first I thought Brandon was|setting me up.

72.「あとは オメーにも 想像つくだろ？| 仮面を着けたオレは オメーをおとりにして: You can guess the rest, can't you? I was the|one in the mask, using you as bait to find out|what they were up to.

73.「うまい具合に ブランドンは 月光の花集めに| オメーを使ったりして おかげで: Brandon was so good about using you to collect|the moonlight flowers, that I now know what|he's up to.

74.「しかし まさか 元弟子のセインズが| ブランドンの手下に 成りさがってるとはな: I had no idea that my former apprentice,|Sainz, was now Brandon's lackey. I was wrong|about that one.

75.「……これで オレに話せることは 全部だ。| 今まで 利用してきて すまなかった: That's all I have to say. I'm sorry I ever|took advantage of you. But it's also true that|I saw something shiny in you.

76.「……はい？ 私ですか？| 私は たまたま 受け付けをまかされていた| 善良な: ...Yes? Am I? I'm just a good Coliseum|employee who happens to be in charge of the|reception desk.

77.「よく 見た目や 笑い方が 怪しいからって| 何か企んでるんじゃ？……と疑われる:
People often suspect that I am up to something|just because of my suspicious appearance and|the way I smile. It's totally rude, isn't it?|
|That's very rude of them.

78.「予想外の連続で いまだ 勝者は決せず。| どうなる？ どうなってしまう！？|: The winner has yet to be decided. What will|happen? What will happen? The 1st Batolympics|Final Battle!
